src.ddpsc.phenocv.computer_vision

Class Histogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.ddpsc.phenocv.computer_vision.Histogram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Releasable

    public final class Histogram
extends java.lang.Object
implements Releasable
    A histogram is a measure of the overall color of each pixel in an image. The histogram can represents any color space desired by the user. These histograms are only 3D histograms are they have the highest fidelity and best isolation rate when back-projecting. As this API is specialized for plant identification, ancillary elements like GrayImage histograms and 2D histograms are excluded. The main purpose of this class is to get a histogram and then back-project it onto a different image in an attempt to isolate certain elements of an image.

    • Method Detail

      • blank

        public static Histogram blank(HistogramPartition histogramPartition)
        Creates a blank histogram that has no values in it.
        Parameters:
        histogramPartition - histogram type to initialize
        Returns:
        a blank histogram

      • copy

        public Histogram copy()
        Copies this histogram into a new one. This is a deep copy.
        Returns:
        a copy of this histogram

      • backProjectionOf

        public GrayImage backProjectionOf(ColorImage image)
        Returns a GrayImage with each pixel representing the probability that the supplied image's corresponding pixel is in this histogram. The brighter the pixel in the output mask, the more likely the corresponding pixel in the supplied image is in the histogram. The output mask is of the same dimensions as the input image.
        Parameters:
        image - image to back project onto
        Returns:
        mask representing back projection probabilities
        See Also:
        GrayImage

      • fromImage

        public static Histogram fromImage(HistogramPartition histogramPartition,
                                  ColorImage image,
                                  GrayImage mask)
        Creates a histogram from a ColorImage and the pixels its mask lets show through. The mask must be of the same dimensions as the image.
        Parameters:
        histogramPartition - type of histogram to generate from the image
        image - image to generate the histogram from
        mask - mask to hide particular pixels in the image
        Returns:
        a histogram describing the image and mask
        See Also:
        GrayImage

      • fromImage

        public static Histogram fromImage(HistogramPartition histogramPartition,
                                  ColorImage image)
        Creates a histogram from every pixel of the supplied ColorImage.
        Parameters:
        histogramPartition - type of histogram to generate from the image
        image - image to generate the histogram from
        Returns:
        a histogram describing the image

      • addImageData

        public void addImageData(ColorImage image,
                         GrayImage mask)
        Adds the histogram of the supplied image-mask combo to this histogram. Similar to fromImage(HistogramPartition, ColorImage, GrayImage), but instead of returning a new histogram, it adds the data to this histogram.
        Parameters:
        image - image to get histogram data from
        mask - mask to select which pixels are turned into histogram data
        See Also:
        ColorImage, GrayImage

      • addImageData

        public void addImageData(ColorImage image)
        Adds the histogram of the supplied ColorImage to this histogram. Similar to fromImage(HistogramPartition, ColorImage), but instead of returning a new histogram, it adds the data to this histogram.
        Parameters:
        image - image to get histogram data from
